business_summary: This database supports an internal operations platform used by an industrial organization to manage (1) employee task checklists and delegated tasks with reminders, attachments, status tracking and delay measurement, (2) sales lead/enquiry-to-order tracking and quotation generation, (3) plant operational registers and quality checklists (steel/rolling/CCM/SMS production forms), and (4) supporting administrative workflows such as visitor gate passes, leave requests, store GRN approvals, indents and approvals, travel/ticket booking and hiring/resume intake. The schema indicates multiple modules consolidated into one system with partially overlapping/duplicated tables (e.g., enquiry tracking in several forms, users vs login vs users_staging) and a mix of structured columns plus semi-structured JSON/text fields.

delegation.description: Operational delegation/assignment of one-time tasks from a giver (manager/admin) to a named person/department, with planned and submission dates and computed delay.

foreign_keys.references: unknown (likely a UI color/priority master or user id)

column_descriptions.task_id: Unique identifier for a delegated task
column_descriptions.created_at: When the task record was created
column_descriptions.department: Department responsible for completing the task
column_descriptions.name: Assignee name (stored as free text)
column_descriptions.frequency: Task recurrence type (here appears to be one-time)
column_descriptions.task_start_date: Start date/time when task should begin
column_descriptions.color_code_for: UI color/priority tag or category reference
column_descriptions.delay: Time difference between planned and submitted (can be negative if early)

delegation_done.description: Event/history table capturing completion or extension actions for delegated tasks, including reasons and optional proof image.

column_descriptions.task_id: Delegated task identifier this event relates to
column_descriptions.next_extend_date: New planned date if task was extended
column_descriptions.reason: Reason for extension or completion note
column_descriptions.name: Assignee name snapshot at time of event
column_descriptions.task_description: Task description snapshot at time of event
column_descriptions.given_by: Assigner snapshot at time of event

checklist.description: Generated checklist tasks (often recurring) assigned to users/departments, tracked for reminder, attachment requirement, planned date and completion states including admin confirmation.

column_descriptions.task_id: Unique identifier for the checklist task instance
column_descriptions.department: Department accountable for the checklist item
column_descriptions.name: Assignee user name (free text)
column_descriptions.frequency: Recurrence pattern (daily/weekly/monthly/one time etc.; inconsistent casing)
column_descriptions.status: Completion flag (yes/no variants) likely user-completion indicator
column_descriptions.delay: Interval between planned and submission (if computed/populated)
column_descriptions.planned_date: Planned schedule datetime (stored as text ISO in sample)
column_descriptions.created_at: When the task instance was created
column_descriptions.task_start_date: When the task is scheduled to start

working_day_calender.description: Calendar dimension table listing dates with day-of-week, week number and month for planning/working day calculations.

column_descriptions.week_num: Week number in year (or fiscal/calendar week)

users.description: Core user/employee master for the platform, including authentication fields and fine-grained access controls across modules/pages/stores and HR-related fields like leave and punch device.

column_descriptions.user_name: Display/user name (also used as assignee text in other tables)
column_descriptions.password: Password (appears stored as plain text; security risk)
column_descriptions.employee_id: Employee code used across HR/store modules
column_descriptions.user_access1: Detailed physical/location or area access list (comma-separated)
column_descriptions.verify_access_dept: Departments the user can verify for

users_staging.description: Staging/import table for users prior to finalizing into users; similar structure with fewer access fields.

login.description: Legacy/alternate authentication table duplicating user credentials and basic profile fields; likely superseded by users.

departments.description: Department master list with optional HOD and contact number.

systems.description: Master list of application modules/systems and their web links used for navigation/SSO-style launching.

column_descriptions.link: Base URL to access the system

visitors.description: Visitor gate pass log capturing visitor identity, purpose, person to meet, entry/exit times and approval workflow.

person_to_meet.description: Directory of employees/hosts available for visitor selection, with phone numbers.

leave_request.description: Employee leave application workflow including multi-step approvals (manager/HOD, HR, commercial head) and date range.

store_grn.description: Goods Receipt Note (GRN) bill tracking and approval workflow (bill sent, admin approval, GM approval, closure).

column_descriptions.sended_bill: Whether bill/invoice was sent for processing

indent.description: Line-level store/purchase indent (or requisition) records including item details, quantities, planning/actual timestamps and approval status.

column_descriptions.time_delay_1: Time delay between planned and actual (stored as varchar)

indent_approvals.description: Approval log entries for indents, capturing approver, date, remarks and status.

column_descriptions.approver_id: Approver identifier (likely employee code or login id)

indent_requests.description: Header-level indent request table (indent number, department, requester, priority) intended to group multiple indent_items; appears separate from indent line table.

indent_items.description: Items associated with an indent request header (indent_requests), storing item name and requested quantity; supports stock visibility.

column_descriptions.available_stock: Stock available at time of request (if populated)

repair_followup.description: Repair gate pass follow-up tracker for items sent out for repair, with staged planned vs actual dates and delays for two stages and overall status.

ticket_book.description: Ticket booking/billing records for travel, including bill details, amounts, and employee codes for requester and booked person.

request.description: Generic request/workflow table used for multiple request types (travel, manpower, etc.) capturing date ranges, travel details, requester context and status.

resume_request.description: Candidate/resume intake for hiring, including interview planning/actuals and candidate/joining status.

clients.description: Sales client/customer master with assigned sales person, type segmentation and status.

client_followups.description: Periodic calling/follow-up log per client and sales person, with optional actual order amount/date and next calling date.

column_descriptions.actual_order: Order value realized (if any) from follow-up

make_quotation.description: Quotation document header storing consignor/consignee details, commercial terms, line items (JSON), PDF output URL and grand total.

column_descriptions.items: Quotation line items JSON (products, qty, rate, gst etc.)

fms_leads.description: Lead management table (likely imported from another system) capturing lead details, enquiry conversion info, follow-ups, order receipt, and commercial terms; largely stored as TEXT including dates.

column_descriptions.enquiry_received_status: Whether an enquiry was received from lead
column_descriptions.item_qty: Requested items/quantities JSON stored as text

enquiry_to_order.description: Structured enquiry lifecycle record used to track conversion from enquiry to order, including follow-up scheduling, acceptance, payment/transport terms, and delay metrics.

column_descriptions.item_qty: Items and quantities as JSON string
column_descriptions.planned_days: Planned lead time days for the stage

enquiry_tracker.description: Enquiry follow-up snapshot/history tracker capturing changing statuses, next call scheduling, and order/hold reasons; dates and times often stored as TEXT.

column_descriptions.enquiry_no: Enquiry/lead identifier (can be EN-xx or LD-xxx per sample)
column_descriptions.if_no_relevant_reason_status: Reason category if no relevant progress/order

leads_tracker.description: Lead tracking table intended to store lead status progression and calling metrics; sample indicates column/value misalignment suggesting ingestion/mapping issues.

column_descriptions.lead_no: Lead number (LD-xxx) (data quality issues in sample)
column_descriptions.lead_source: Lead source (data quality issues in sample)
column_descriptions.company_name: Company name or flags (data quality issues in sample)
column_descriptions.phone_number: Phone number (data quality issues in sample)
column_descriptions.sales_person_name: Sales person (data quality issues in sample)
column_descriptions.location: Location or item_qty JSON (data quality issues in sample)
column_descriptions.email_address: Email or quantity (data quality issues in sample)

dropdown.description: Central configuration table storing allowed values for many UI dropdowns across the sales/quotation modules (and some masters like item lists and bank details).

column_descriptions.payment_terms_days: Allowed payment terms day values (inconsistent formats)

size_master.description: Master of product sizes and thickness by item type (round/square/rectangular) used for ERP enquiries/production.

enq_erp.description: ERP enquiry capture at item-dimension level (type/size/thickness) with customer, quantity and sales executive; likely used for production planning/demand.

sms_register.description: Steel Melt Shop (SMS) register/log capturing sequence and ladle numbers, furnace info, temperatures, shift incharge and media links.

column_descriptions.unique_code: Unique tracking code for the entry

hot_coil.description: Hot coiler operational checklist/log capturing temperatures by strand, personnel roles and remarks, with update link.

tundish_checklist.description: Tundish process checklist capturing casting parameters, temperatures and equipment conditions, keyed by unique_code.

column_descriptions.unique_code: Unique code (non-null; used as natural key)

re_coile.description: Recoiler log (variant table name) capturing hot coiler short code, personnel and machine, keyed by unique_code.

column_descriptions.hot_coiler_short_code: Reference to hot coiler record/short code

re_coiler.description: Recoiler log (duplicate/standardized table) similar to re_coile; likely the intended canonical table.

column_descriptions.hot_coiler_short_code: Reference to hot coiler short code

qc_lab_samples.description: Quality control lab chemical test results per SMS batch/heat/ladle/sequence, including final composition and report image.

pipe_mill.description: Pipe mill operational log capturing equipment checks, production, job timing, item attributes, personnel and remarks.

laddle_return.description: Ladle return form capturing return date/time, temperatures, crane drivers/operators involved, and return reason.

laddle_checklist.description: Ladle checklist/inspection capturing cleaning and equipment condition checks plus personnel, keyed by unique_code and date/ladle number.

plant_visitor.description: Plant visit request workflow (distinct from gate pass visitor log) for planned visits, headcount, reason, and approval status.

column_descriptions.employee_code: Employee code of requester or related employee

suggested_semantic_schema:
SYSTEM OVERVIEW:
- This database is a multi-module internal operations platform.
- Major domains:
  1) Task Management: checklist (recurring tasks) and delegation (one-off delegated tasks) with completion/extension history in delegation_done.
  2) Sales CRM: leads and enquiries tracked through enquiry_to_order, enquiry_tracker, fms_leads, clients, client_followups, and quotations in make_quotation. dropdown stores allowed UI values.
  3) Operations/Production: SMS/CCM/Pipe Mill and QC logs (sms_register, tundish_checklist, hot_coil, re_coiler/re_coile, pipe_mill, qc_lab_samples, laddle_return, laddle_checklist).
  4) Admin/HR/Store: users, departments, systems, visitors/person_to_meet, leave_request, store_grn, indent (+ approvals/items/requests), repair_followup, travel/ticket_book, generic request, resume_request.

ENTITY NOTES & JOIN GUIDANCE (IMPORTANT FOR TEXT-TO-SQL):
- users(id) is the canonical user identifier, but many tables store person names as TEXT (e.g., delegation.name, delegation.given_by, checklist.name, visitors.approved_by). Prefer name-based joins only when needed and treat them as fuzzy/unenforced.
- departments.department is referenced by text from users.department, checklist.department, delegation.department.
- Delegation lifecycle:
  - delegation.task_id is the task.
  - delegation_done stores events per task_id with status in (done/completed/extend) and next_extend_date for extensions.
- Checklist lifecycle:
  - checklist.task_id represents a scheduled instance (often many rows for a recurring template).
  - Completion indicators are inconsistent: checklist.status, checklist.user_status_checklist, and checklist.admin_done. Normalize in queries using case-insensitive comparisons.
- Sales lifecycle:
  - enquiries exist in multiple forms. Prefer enquiry_to_order for typed dates/booleans; enquiry_tracker is more like history/snapshots and stores many values as TEXT.
  - fms_leads appears to be an imported lead table with most fields as TEXT.
  - clients is customer master; client_followups logs calling activity.
  - make_quotation stores quotation header and items as JSONB.
- Store/Indent:
  - indent is line-level with one row per item requested (includes item_code/product_name).
  - indent_requests + indent_items represent a separate header/items pattern; may be unused/alternate.
  - indent_approvals logs approvals; approver_id format is ambiguous (could be employee code or login id).
- Visitor Management:
  - visitors logs actual entries/exits; person_to_meet is a directory.
  - plant_visitor represents planned visit requests.

CANONICAL METRICS (RECOMMENDED DEFINITIONS FOR ANALYTICS):
- Task delay:
  - delegation.delay is an INTERVAL; negative means early.
  - checklist.delay is INTERVAL but often null; compute as submission_date - task_start_date or planned_date when planned_date is parseable.
- Task completion:
  - Delegation complete when delegation.status ILIKE 'done%' OR latest delegation_done.status in ('done','completed').
  - Checklist complete when user_status_checklist ILIKE 'yes' OR status ILIKE 'yes'; admin confirmation when admin_done ILIKE 'confirmed%' OR 'done'.
- Sales conversion:
  - enquiry_to_order.is_order_received = true indicates order received.
  - For tracker tables, use is_order_received_status in ('yes') but beware of 'hold'.

DATA QUALITY WARNINGS:
- Many categorical fields have inconsistent casing and duplicates (Done vs done, Monthly vs monthly). Use LOWER() normalization.
- Several date/time fields are stored as TEXT in some tables (checklist.planned_date, enquiry_tracker.next_call_date/time, fms_leads.*). Parse carefully or filter to rows where casting succeeds.
- leads_tracker sample suggests mis-mapped columns; treat it as unreliable unless validated.
- re_coile and re_coiler appear duplicated; prefer re_coiler if both exist.

EXAMPLE QUERY INTENTS (FOR AGENT):
- 'Overdue delegated tasks': delegation where planned_date < now and (status not done) and submission_date is null.
- 'Checklist compliance by department per day': group checklist by department and date(task_start_date) with completion flags.
- 'Enquiries pending follow-up': enquiry_to_order where next_call_date is not null and is_order_received is not true.
- 'GRN pending approvals': store_grn where approved_by_admin=false OR approved_by_gm=false OR close_bill=false.
- 'Indent pending': indent where request_status='PENDING' or gm_approval is null.

NAMING CONVENTIONS (SUGGESTED NORMALIZED LAYER):
- Normalize person references to user_id where possible; otherwise keep *_name as descriptive.
- Create views:
  - v_delegation_current (latest status from delegation + latest delegation_done)
  - v_checklist_normalized (normalized yes/no, parsed planned_date)
  - v_enquiry_normalized (prefer enquiry_to_order + optional tracker history)
